page.title: 07Farms
page.content:
1925
Cattle Cake had just been invented.This was made from Linseed Oiland had to be cracked from slabs. Milking was by hand. Cattle were fed on chopped straw, pulped mangolds and wet grains from Burton-on-Trent when they were available.
1945
Tractors had come in during the war. Theycost between Â£400 and Â£500. Some were available for Â£100 with spade lugs. This was a government subsidy because people in the towns were starving, with only 2 hens eggs per week to eat. Used combine harvesters were imported from Canada at a cost of Â£600, but were not really suitasble for the English corn.
